Name: QuestionItemName
Description: A name for the QuestionItem. May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat the element to express names with different content, for example different names for different systems.

Name: InParameter
Description: Provides an identity for input objects required for the QuestionItem.

Name: OutParameter
Description: Provides an identify for the output objects of the QuestionItem.

Name: Binding
Description: A structure used to bind the content of a parameter declared as the source to a parameter declared as the target. For example, binding the OutParameter of one Question to the InParameter of another Question in order to personalize a question text. Care should be taken to bind only reusable information at this level. Binding is also available at the QuestionConstruct to reflect bindings particular to the use of the question in a specific question flow or instrument.

Name: QuestionText
Description: The text of a question. Supports the use of DynamicText. Note that when using QuestionText, the full QuestionText must be repeated for multi-language versions of the content. Different languages may handle the dynamic portions in different locations and/or with different content. Therefore languages cannot be mixed within a dynamic text except when the full text itself has multiple language sections, for example, a foreign language term in a text. The DisplayText may also be repeated to provide a dynamic and plain text version of the display. This allows for accurate rendering of the QuestionText in a non-dynamic environment like print.

Name: QuestionIntent
Description: The purpose of the QuestionItem in terms of what it is designed to measure.

Name: ResponseDomain
Description: Contains a response domain for the question item. Typically used to describe simple response domains (textual, numeric, etc.).

Name: ResponseDomainReference_ManagedMissingValuesRepresentation
Description: The inclusion of a response domain by reference (must be supported by a managed representation). An abstract element. May be substituted by any valid object of substitution type ResponseDomainReference.

Name: ResponseDomainReference_ManagedScaleRepresentation
Description: The inclusion of a response domain by reference (must be supported by a managed representation). An abstract element. May be substituted by any valid object of substitution type ResponseDomainReference.

Name: ResponseDomainReference_ManagedNumericRepresentation
Description: The inclusion of a response domain by reference (must be supported by a managed representation). An abstract element. May be substituted by any valid object of substitution type ResponseDomainReference.

Name: ResponseDomainReference_ManagedDateTimeRepresentation
Description: The inclusion of a response domain by reference (must be supported by a managed representation). An abstract element. May be substituted by any valid object of substitution type ResponseDomainReference.

Name: ResponseDomainReference_ManagedTextRepresentation
Description: The inclusion of a response domain by reference (must be supported by a managed representation). An abstract element. May be substituted by any valid object of substitution type ResponseDomainReference.

Name: StructuredMixedResponseDomain
Description: Use in cases where the question requires the option for multiple response domains, such as a category response and a text response to specify a value for "Other", or when text needs to be inserted before, after, or between response options for the question.

Name: ResponseCardinality
Description: Allows the designation of the minimum and maximum number of responses allowed for this question. Note that each response domain has its own response cardinality.

Name: ConceptReference
Description: A reference to the concept associated with the response to the question.

Name: ExternalAid
Description: A pointer to an external aid presented by the instrument such as a text card, image, audio, or audiovisual aid. Typically a URN. Use type attribute to describe the type of external aid provided. Example of terms to use would include: imageOnly audioOnly audioVisual multiMedia.

Name: ExternalInterviewerInstruction
Description: External reference to an interviewer instruction not expressed as DDI XML using OtherMaterial.

Name: InterviewerInstructionReference
Description: Reference to an interviewer instruction expressed as DDI XML.

Name: EstimatedSecondsResponseTime
Description: The estimated amount of time required to answer a question expressed in seconds. Decimal values should be used to define fractions of seconds.
